War costs lives Donald Rumsfeld , who served as Bush's defence chief for six years after holding the the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives. n't been talking on this one," says Democratic Sen. Bernie Sanders Raul Grijalva, who represents part of Tucson. The congressman isn't criticizing John McCain 's decision, but says the senator's voice will be needed soon. It would be helpful for all of us to deal with the question of rhetoric, hyperbole, hate, and anger. John McCain has national prominence and prestige and it would be welcome for him to come and help change the tone. But John McCain has no plans to speak publicly, nor is the possibility even being discussed. spark for Detroit after a slow start, winning his first game since joining the Pistons, 100-92 over the Sacramento Martin Luther King on Tuesday night. "It was a huge lift off of me," Allen Iverson said. I knew it would happen. You think every game you go out and play it's going to happen. It feels good. I wanted to get the monkey off my back. I'm just excited that I got my first win and I can now try to get a lot more. Tayshaun Prince added 26 points and 11 rebounds for the Pistons, who had lost their first two games since acquiring Allen Iverson from Denver last week for All-Star point guard Chauncey Billups , key reserve Antonio McDyess and Cheikh Samb . series at 1-1. Game 3 of the best-of-five Eastern Conference quarterfinals is Saturday in Indiana. "I'm going to remember this game for a long time," said Allen Iverson , who also had nine assists. I've been playing a lot off my God-given ability. This game took a lot of thinking. I'm pleased with my mental aspect coming into the game... When guys doubled me, I found my teammates and they hit the shots. I don't think I forced too many things. Aaron McKie had 19 points and George Lynch added 16 for Philadelphia, which finished as the top team in the East for the first time since 1983-84.
